properties.headline: Lakeshore Flood Warning issued February 14 at 3:49PM EST until February 15 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Grand Rapids MI
properties.description:
* WHAT...Significant beach erosion and lakeshore flooding
expected.

* WHERE...Mason, Oceana and Muskegon counties.

* WHEN...From 1 AM to 7 PM EST Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Significant erosion of beaches and dunes is expected.
Inundation of low-lying areas along the lakeshore, in river
mouths and road closures are possible.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong southwest winds on Saturday of 20-30
mph with gusts over 40 mph will create large waves. The waves
will likely peak around midday Saturday in the 10 to 13 foot
range. The waves on top of a push of water associated with the
wind will result in significant beach and dune erosion. Flooding
of low lying areas is possible, including back into river
channels.
properties.instruction:
Strong winds and high waves will continue to produce hazardous
conditions on piers, breakwaters and unprotected shoreline so
caution is still advised until the winds and waves subside. Winds
and waves of this magnitude produce moderate to severe beach
erosion.

NWSheadline: LAKESHORE FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 7 PM EST SATURDAY
